discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
the correction of this exam is utterly uncceptable . ! the correction is wrong and rediculous .

Selected Answer: B
correct answer is B. The "embrace change" target in PRINCE2 Agile refers to the ability of the project to respond to changing requirements and priorities, and to embrace new ideas and innovations. One way to achieve this is by trading user stories for those of a similar size, which allows the team to be more flexible and adaptable to change without compromising on quality or value delivery.

choices.C: It results in the late delivery of the minimum viable product
choices.D: It degrades the performance of the features that are delivered
choices.B: It trades user stories for those of a similar size
choices.A: It re-establishes team dynamics when a new member joins the team

choices.C: A PRINCE2 project ensures a consistent approach to risk management
choices.D: A PRINCE2 project is tailored to suit the competitorâ€™s environment
choices.B: A PRINCE2 project is monitored and controlled on a stage-by-stage basis
choices.A: A PRINCE2 project defines its quality management approach

questions.question_text: Which statement defines a PRINCE2 principle?

discussion.content:
the correct statement that defines a PRINCE2 principle is not listed among the options.

Option A (A PRINCE2 project defines its quality management approach) describes one of the seven themes in PRINCE2, which is quality management.

Option B (A PRINCE2 project is monitored and controlled on a stage-by-stage basis) describes the 'managing a stage boundary' process in PRINCE2, which involves monitoring and controlling the project's progress at the end of each stage.

Option C (A PRINCE2 project ensures a consistent approach to risk management) describes one of the seven themes in PRINCE2, which is risk management.

Option D (A PRINCE2 project is tailored to suit the competitor's environment) is not correct. PRINCE2 is a project management methodology that is tailored to suit the project's environment, not the competitor's environment

questions.question_text:
Which TWO project board responsibilities are specifically assigned to the senior user?

1. Demonstrating the achievement of benefits.
2. Specifying the needs of those impacted by the outputs.
3. Balancing business, user and supplier demands.
4. Ensuring that the project delivers value for money.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The correct answer is A.

The two project board responsibilities specifically assigned to the senior user are:

 Demonstrating the achievement of benefits: The senior user is responsible for ensuring that the expected benefits of the project are identified, planned for, and delivered. They are also responsible for tracking and reporting on the achievement of these benefits throughout the project.

 Specifying the needs of those impacted by the outputs: The senior user is responsible for identifying the needs of the business, customers, and other stakeholders who will be impacted by the project outputs. They work with the project manager and other members of the project team to ensure that these needs are understood and incorporated into the project plan.

choices.B: A project cannot be referred to as a timebox
choices.A: Flow based working partitions work into timeboxes
choices.C: A timebox can contain another timebox
choices.D: Timeboxes should be avoided in business as usual environments

discussion.content: Answer C is definitly wrong. As per 1.2.2 of Axelos' official PRINCE Agile Book "... Higher-level timeboxes act as aggregated timeboxes and contain lower-level timeboxes (e.g. stages)."

questions.question_text: Which statement about timeboxes is CORRECT?

1. They provide a wider picture of the customer view.
2. They prioritize requirements at the detailed level.
3. They should be focused on the customer.
4. They ensure that the work is compliant with project standards.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
